content: Do we support those response files being compressed .zip? when not coming over a web link with Content-Encoding: gzip, compress
do we have a position on use of http/2 ?
Not with a file share over SMB
I mention http/2 because it has built in data compression, and other features for multi-stream support. Use of it might address the need for which you are specifying gzip
why would we need to say anything about using content-encoding?
